title: get_top_gene_set.py Operon flagging bug
body:
Hi! First off, excellent paper and tool - I really like the streamlined approach to finding promoters in non-model bacteria.

I ran into an issue when running `get_top_gene_set.py` where no matter what I put for `n%` or `min_distance` (i.e. I ran `python3 get_top_gene_set.py rg_data/rg_tpm_mat.tsv locus_tag 100 0 rg_data/sample2condition.txt rg_data/r_gnavus.gb rg_out_data/`) and every gene that was part of the analysis had a `True` boolean in the `op?` column (I suppose this could be possible, but I highly doubt that there wasn't a single gene not part of an operon...).

My best guess is that it is some issue with the formatting of my `.gb` file and how `genbank_utils.py` handles the loci position determination (Here's a[ box link ](https://uchicago.box.com/s/in34hijgrsh1ptgyzjz0ru4adgkfj06e) to the `rg_data/` directory which contains my TPM matrix `.gb` file and `sample2condition.txt` in case you wanted them for the troubleshooting as well as the `rg_out_data/` directory with the faulty file).

This wasn't a major issue for my purposes since I just changed all of the `True` values to `False` values, and just ended up with a bunch of small sequences that I filtered out since they were pretty clearly intergenic regions from an operon.

Thanks in advance, and again thank you for creating this awesome tool!

Jack Arnold
University of Chicago | PME | Mimee Lab

title: Handle case when seq extraction passes over the 0 coordinate of the genome
body:
https://github.com/erinhwilson/promoter-id-from-rnaseq/blob/b5493da3b14c1dda61141d7470c3c0bf83dbeab9/extract_upstream_regions.py#L131

This should be handled differently - probably split into two parts with the pos part of the window slice and a negative part of the window slice
